identificationModule.briefTitle: Thresholds In Food Allergy evaluaTion And predictioN
identificationModule.officialTitle: Thresholds In Food Allergy evaluaTion And predictioN, a Prospective, Multicentre Registry Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Thresholds In food allergy evaluaTion And predictioN, a prospective, observational registry. The aim is to quantify food allergy thresholds in Canada and their clinical predictors.

armGroups.label: Group 1
armGroups.description: Patients with suspected or confirmed food allergy

interventions.name: Oral food challenge
interventions.description: Patients will undergo oral food challenge with increasing amounts of food allergen

primaryOutcomes.measure: Eliciting dose thresholds to food challenge
primaryOutcomes.description: Threshold are measured by controlled food challenge to incremental doses of allergen (g) and are adjudicated according to CoFAR v3.0 criteria

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Food Allergy Quality of Life Questionnaire Child Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: The number of items found in the child form questionnaire includes 30 items. Food allergy quality of life questionnaire is answered on a 7-point scale (0 to 6) with higher scores representing worse impairment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Food Allergy Quality of Life Questionnaire Teen Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: The number of items found in the Teen Form questionnaire includes 26 items. Food allergy quality of life questionnaire is answered on a 7-point scale (0 to 6) with higher scores representing worse impairment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Food Allergy Quality of Life Questionnaire Adult Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: The number of items found in the Adult Form questionnaire includes 35 items. Food allergy quality of life questionnaire is answered on a 7-point scale (0 to 6) with higher scores representing worse impairment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Food Allergy Quality of Life Questionnaire Parent Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: The number of items found in the Parent Form questionnaire includes 38 items. Food allergy quality of life questionnaire consists of 3 to 4 domains, each question is answered on a 7-point scale (0 to 6) with higher scores representing worse impairment.
Measured by flow cytometry (cell frequency basophils and median fluorescence intensity)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Suspicion or history of food allergy based on medical history, positive skin prick test, and/or serum food-specific IgE. A suggestive history is defined as typical clinical signs and/or symptoms (urticaria, angioedema, abdominal pain, vomiting, dyspnea, wheeze) within 60 minutes of the ingestion of a food.
2. Ability to discontinue all antihistamines for 1 week before oral food challenge.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Previous desensitization treatment to a food allergen
2. Allergies to any component of the oral challenge vehicle
3. Unstable conditions including uncontrolled asthma or chronic urticaria
4. Any clinically significant disease/chronic medical condition which may interfere with study evaluations.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All consecutive patients suspected or confirmed to be food allergic

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Will consider on a case by case basis.
